alert.note: Alert for Columbia (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 4:27PM CDT until April 22 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Wisconsin River At Portage affecting Columbia County. .Rain and snow melt through the midweek time period will lead to major flooding on the Wisconsin River at Portage through the upcoming week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wisconsin River at Portage. * WHEN...Until Saturday afternoon, potentially longer. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, There is 1 foot of water over a low section of County Highway V in Portage. Floodwaters affect River Oaks Road and River Shores Road (Lewiston Township) as well as numerous roads in the Blackhawk Park area about 3 miles south of Portage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 PM CDT Monday was 18.9 feet. - Forecast...The forecast including only 24 hours of precipitation has the river rising to 19.0 feet. Runoff from recent rainfall and additional melting snow combined with forecast rainfall of 1-2 inches will likely result in a rise to around 19.5 feet. If there is more rain than expected the river could rise to record levels. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.9 feet on 04/23/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River forecasts are available for some but not all river gaging locations. The 7 day river forecast takes into account past precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and predicted precipitation for the basin. Precipitation is for the next 24 hours in the future from April through September and for 48 hours in the future from October through March. (Stages in ft.) Bank- Latest Forecast stages - Flood full observed ...for 7 pm... Location stage stage stage/time Tue Wed Thu Fri Portage 17.0 12.7 18.77 3 pm 4/17 18.8 18.9 19.0 17.4 - Highest 24 hour change - observed in river stage - stage in (ft.) up to Highest stage - the last latest observed forecast in - 7 days stage next 7 days Portage 18.89 2 pm 4/17 0.20 19.00 1 am 4/21 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 430 AM CDT.
